intro: Clinanthus viridiflorus, commonly known as the green-flowered clinanthus, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has palmately lobed leaves. Clinanthus viridiflorus is an herbaceous perennial that is relatively rare and of conservation interest.
